channel.title: Homes on Michael Beyeler
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Michael Beyeler

item.description: My research focuses on helping the blind see again. More specifically, I am working on computational models of bionic vision, with the goal of improving the perceptual experience of blind patients implanted with a retinal prosthesis (‘bionic eye’). Accepted a tenure-track faculty position in the Departments of Computer Science and Psychological & Brain Sciences at UC Santa Barbara (Nov 2019). New article out in Frontiers in Neuroscience on the potential role of retinal sheet tranplants for sight recovery.

item.title: Research
item.description: The 'bionic eye'—so long a dream of the future—is finally becoming a reality with retinal prostheses available in the US and Europe (Fig. 1; over 300 patients implanted). With cortical implants, optogenetic approaches, and stem cell therapy in development, a wide range of sight recovery (SR) options will be available to patients suffering from severe blindness. Despite the increasing clinical and commercial use of these devices, the perceptual experience of SR patients is surprisingly poorly understood.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: Selected Guest Lectures BIOEN-460: Neural Engineering University of Washington, undergraduate. Lecturers: Prof. Raj Rao, Chet Moritz. Slides -- 2018 PSYCH-508: Core Concepts in Perception University of Washington, graduate. Lecturer: Prof. Ione Fine. 2018 NRSC-490: Advanced Topics in Neuroscience University of Puget Sound, undergraduate. Lecturer: Dr. Alex White. 2017 PSYCH-268A: Computational Neuroscience University of California, Irvine, undergraduate.

item.title: Awards
item.description: Grants and Funding NIH K99 Pathway to Independence Award EY-029329: Virtual prototyping for retinal prosthesis patients Role: PI 2018 - present ($244,882) Cloud Credits for Research Award Amazon Web Services (AWS) 2017 - 2018 ($10,000) Honors and Awards NIH K99 Pathway to Independence Award: National Eye Institute 2018 - present Platform Presenter: Eye & Chip World Congress on Artificial Vision 2017 Presenter’s Travel Award: Computational & Systems Neuroscience (COSYNE) 2017 Innovation in Neuroengineering & Data Science Postdoctoral Fellowship: Gordon & Betty Moore Foundation, Alfred P.
